text:
38 yo W with PMH of relapsed ALL admitted on [**6-30**] with neutropenic
   fever. Workup at that time was unrevealing. She then began re-induction
   on [**7-12**]. She is now D 15 s/p cytarabine chemotherapy with plan for allo
   BMT. She is currently at her count nadir. Her inpatient course has been
   complicated by C diff ([**7-18**]), acute pancreatitis ([**8-10**]), pericardial
   effusion with ? tamponade ([**8-15**]) and VRE sepsis ([**8-16**]). She has been
   found to be more tachypneic over the last several days. She was  noted
   to have rigors [**8-18**] in AM and received demerol- C/O new headache that
   began [**8-17**]; denies CP, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting. She has known
   vaginal bleeding that is normally treated with and has been passing
   clots.
   PEA arrest at 1500 yesterday during a thoracentesis- epi and atropine
   given; intubated; and A-line placed
   Troponin- 0.03 CK 920
   Neutropenic precautions- WBC 0.1; GPC grew out in BC. Blood cultures
   drawn again this AM. 95.8 oral temp- bear hugger applied
   Platelets 41- Bleeding evident in nares after NGT placed which stopped
   after guaze was placed.
   Social: Aunt from [**Name2 (NI) 490**] who is a nurse called and plans to arrive
   here tomorrow night. I spoke with her about the pt
s current state and
   the events surrounding the pea arrest yesterday. I also referred her to
   the MD on who spoke with her regarding her plan of care.
   Hypertension, benign
   Assessment:
   Beginning of shift pt
s ABP 180
s/130
s on 2 mg/hr of labetelol-
   Labetelol drip increased to a max of 5 mg/hr and eventually turned off
   with a steady SBP 115-120
s MAP of 100. NSR 70-80
s. CVP 19-20. Pt
   sedated on 75 mcg/hr of fentanyl and 2 mg/hr of versed. General edema
   noted; bilateral DP
s palpable, PT
s dopplerable Total of 1 L diuresed
   since 1900 last night [**8-18**] (10 mg lasix given between blood and another
   10 given after). UO dropped to 15 cc/hr of concentrated urine at 0200
   (MD informed, no intervention prescribed) BUN 24 CR 0.9
   Action:
   Titrated labetelol drip as needed. Increased sedation beginning of
   shift due to hypertension and biting of ETT. 10 mg of lasix adminstered
   with a 300 UO response and no change in CVP. 1 U of PRBC given (2^nd of
   2)
   Response:
   After upward titration of labetelol pt
s BP responded accordingly and
   was eventually able to turn of the labetelol- ABP steady at
   115-120/80
s.  Remains Sedated and comfortable at 75 mcg of fentanyl
   and 2 mg of versed. UO remains minimal at 15 cc/hr, MD informed and ?
   with bolus need but decided to wait until morning Labs back.
   Plan:
   Monitor ABP- watching DBP and MAP. Labetolol if needed. Assess for any
   pain or continued HA. Adequate sedation. ?? ideology of minimal UO
   response to lasix with a CVP 20; seems to be intravascularly dry- ?
   need for IVF
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 2**])
   Assessment:
   Intubated on A/C 40%/500/20/5. Plateau pressure 32. MV 8. Bilateral
   pleural effusions. Biting of ETT observed but treated with increased
   sedation and bite block. Sp02 100%. Lungs clear; diminshed at bases.
   Small amounts of thick yellow secretions suctioned. Last ABG at 1900
   last night- 7.37/35/153
   Action:
   Frequent turns; suctioning; mouth care. Lowered Fi02 to current setting
   of 40% from 50%.
   Response:
   Remains on A/C. Secretions remain thick and yellow. No spontaneous
   breaths during RSBI
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor ventilation. Adequate sedation. Monitor ABG
